intro: Rauvolfia chinensis, commonly known as Chinese snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by capsule fruits containing elliptical seeds. Its roots are rich in alkaloids, particularly reserpine, which has been used in traditional medicine. Due to its medicinal properties, it is also cultivated for pharmaceutical purposes.
